meanings.definition: To tremble or shake involuntarily, typically as a result of fear or disgust.
meanings.sent1: The little dog would shudder whenever it heard thunder.
meanings.sent2: I shudder at the thought of going into that haunted house.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating broccoli made him shudder with pretend fear.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident made her shudder with worry.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the dark forest made her shudder uncontrollably.

meanings.sent1: A shudder ran down his spine as he watched the horror movie.
meanings.sent2: The sudden cold wind caused a shudder to pass through the group.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly dance made the audience burst into a shudder of laughter.
meanings.sent4: The old house gave off a shudder as if it had a life of its own.
meanings.sent5: The intensity of the earthquake sent a shudder through the entire town.
